sentences: Tallinna raamatusõprade klubi on populaarne huviring.
Meie kooli klubis toimub iga nädal tantsuõhtu.
context: In Estonian, 'klubi' primarily refers to an organization or group of people with shared interests, professions, or views. It can also refer to the physical meeting place for such a group. The word comes from Germanic languages (like German 'Klub') and has various compound forms specifying different types of clubs (e.g., spordiklubi = sports club, ööklubi = night club). Estonian grammar shows it belongs to declension type 17/elu with no gradation.
